intro: Dolicholoma jasminiflorum, commonly known as the jasmine-flowered dolicholoma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is characterized by its attractive, fragrant flowers that resemble those of jasmine, typically white or pale yellow in color. The plant has opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves, and its stems are usually erect or ascending. It is native to certain regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. The flowers bloom in clusters and are pollinated primarily by insects.
